title.value: Tell Me How to Survey: Literature Review Made Simple with Automatic Reading Path Generation
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned in both the abstract and the metadata provided at the beginning of the paper document.
title.quote: Tell Me How to Survey: Literature Review Made Simple with Automatic Reading Path Generation

extractions.description: The paper introduces a new task named Reading Path Generation (RPG) designed to help researchers quickly become familiar with a new research field by generating a structured reading path. It also proposes SurveyBank, a dataset consisting of survey papers and their citation relationships, and suggests a graph-optimization-based approach for generating reading paths.

type.justification: The paper details the introduction and evaluation of a system for Reading Path Generation, complete with experiments and systematic evaluation on a newly proposed dataset, SurveyBank.
type.quote: Extensive evaluations demonstrate that our approach outperforms other baselines. A real-time Reading Path Generation (RePaGer) system has been also implemented with our designed model.

name.justification: The paper mentions tasks like 'Reading Path Generation' which fall under Natural Language Processing, and it covers topics such as analyzing academic papers and generating reading paths based on citation networks.
name.quote: Given a research topic, people usually rely on academic search engines such as Google Scholar to retrieve a list of papers to read.

name.justification: The task of generating a reading path from academic papers retrieved from search engines is closely related to Information Retrieval.
name.quote: Existing academic search engines return relevant papers by individually calculating the relevance between each paper and query.

name.justification: RePaGer is explicitly named as a reading path generation system utilized in the research.
name.quote: A real-time Reading Path Generation (RePaGer) system has been also implemented with our designed model.
